title: Turmeric (Curcuma longa)
summary: Turmeric contains curcuminoids with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties; best absorbed with fat and black pepper (piperine).

evidence.title: Knee Osteoarthritis (Pain/Function)
evidence.summary: Curcumin extracts show modest pain and function improvements vs placebo in knee OA.
evidence.citation: Daily et al. J Med Food 2016; Bannuru et al. Ann Intern Med 2015 (network meta-analysis).

evidence.title: Inflammation Markers
evidence.summary: Curcumin may reduce CRP and other inflammatory markers in metabolic risk.
evidence.citation: Sahebkar A. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol 2014; meta-analyses of curcumin on CRP.

safety: Generally well tolerated; GI upset possible.
High-dose supplements may affect gallbladder issues.
banm_applications: Culinary use: ½–1 tsp turmeric powder in curries, soups, eggs; add black pepper and fat for absorption.
Golden milk: turmeric + milk/alt milk + pepper; optional ginger/cinnamon.

authenticity.issue: Supplement quality varies; some powders adulterated.
authenticity.recommendation: Prefer reputable brands; standardized extracts for supplements when indicated.
